bibl.title: The Cultural Transformation of Egypt as Suggested by a Group of Enthroned Male Figures from the Faiyum.
bibl.note: Group of 12 statues of enthroned intercessors. These pharaonic images are made meaningful, by the addition of a Greek or Demotic inscription, to those members of society not conversant in the hieroglyphs in the Faiyum during the first century A.D.

bibl.title: Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond

bibl.seg: BIANCHI Robert S., The Cultural Transformation of Egypt as Suggested by a Group of Enthroned Male Figures from the Faiyum.
Janet H. JOHNSON (Ed.), Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond = SAOC. 51 (Chicago, 1992) pp. 15-39, 13 pll.

Group of 12 statues of enthroned intercessors. These pharaonic images are made meaningful, by the addition of a Greek or Demotic inscription, to those members of society not conversant in the hieroglyphs in the Faiyum during the first century A.D.
